intro: Dioscorea hirsuta, commonly known as hairy yam, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces tuberous roots that are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The tubers of D. hirsuta contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
